website_summaries.verdict: You get what you pay for, but many folks with only an occasional need to drill will be happy with it.
pros: A very popular drill that will come in handy for all sorts of home projects
Several kit options so you get all the accessories you want without too many parts you don't need
cons: Down on power and battery life
Battery takes too long to recharge, and only one is included

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk! Battery fully charged & worked for the 1st 3 screws that I placed into a 1/2" plywood. However, it could not complete the process on the 4th screw. Motor kept running like there was no problem, however, it just could not screw it in. I played with the clutch, trying all the adjustments but it didn't remedy the situation at all. Big, big mistake, bought it about a month earlier than use because I had Amazon ship it to another site where I had some work to do, so couldn't return the item I definitely would not recommend this product. Good paper weight, though!
customer_reviews.author: 808 Go Cougs

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product, Chuck Seizes up
customer_reviews.text: Returned this drill several times. It is a very defective model. The chuck seizes up and cannot open. I don't recommend buying one of these. Very disappointing because the $25 el cheapo black and decker drill I bought in Walmart 7 years ago still works and this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Austinite101

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead less than 2 months after purchase date!
customer_reviews.text: I have had other black and decker products in the past, they all worked well and have lasted for years. However, the battery that came with this drill is dead already. I have two different B&D chargers and this battery will not charge on either charger. Light blinks fast red constantly as soon as I plug the charger in. I hate to provide a bad review for a usually reliable product. However, this may be enough for me to look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend After Several Months Of Use
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about 2 months now and have used it extensively. Haven't identified any real weaknesses or drawbacks to it yet. Battery life is good to excellent. It's light and torquey. Bit install is quick easy and right. It's quite a bit smaller than my previous black and decker drill. Two of the best things about this drill is the LED light that illuminates the area to be drilled and it stands up on its own when placed on its battery base on a table or floor. Highly recommended unit. If my review has been helpful to you, please click the button below to indicate that.
customer_reviews.author: Carbona Not Glue

customer_reviews.title: Chuck stuck, unusable
customer_reviews.text: Could not lossen the chuck after unpacking it. Chuck was stuck in the open position. Checking online, others have had this problem with B&D drills. I tried every online solution and was unable to lossen the chuck.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love this drill. Makes me want to drill holes in everything i see.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? As a female, who is not very handy, I've always thought drills were overrated. Using the 7.5 volts my whole life, I always struggled to successfully drive even a single nail into something i was building and usually ended up doing it by muscling my way through it with a screw driver. No more! I used this baby to drive a nail into a metal door and then got so excited i started drilling everything i could find. I love this drill! I just hope my house isn't full of holes after i get done b/c this baby has so much power that i just want to keep using it for everything.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ardito

customer_reviews.title: 1 star
customer_reviews.text: When it first came it was great, now I have had it for 3 months and it won't work! Start to drill and it quits after a couple seconds and then will not re-start until you wait a couple minutes. Worthless piece of Junk that you cannot drill with because it won't continue to run and they say it is too late to return it. Don't buy this item, total junk!
customer_reviews.author: Vants Anseth

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! I used it twice (a couple of screws into wood) and worked like a charm. I didn't use it for about a month and when I tried to drill a couple of holes into half inch plywood with a fully charged battery it wouldn't turn over. All I got was a light, no sound, no nothing. Maybe I got the broken one; I've owned Black and Decker plug in tools which always surpassed my expectations. It's been over 30 days so now I have to figure out if amazon will replace it or refund me.
customer_reviews.author: Francis A

customer_reviews.title: Low expectations met
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for prime day. Not expecting a Makita or even a Ryobi. The power seems adequate. My biggest gripe is that it doesn’t have switchable gearing for driving screws and drilling holes. This keeps it from excelling at either task. When driving screws, there’s not enough torque at low speed, so you end up pushing harder to keep the driver from bouncing out of the screw. Best to just push hard, use full power and let the clutch decide when to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Horace James

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight Light duty homeowners drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a light weight light duty homeowners drill. Great for small jobs like assembling deck chairs and furniture. It will drill holes in sheet metal and 2X4 easily but not all day long. Have not had any trouble with chuck as some reviews say and the battery life is good for light duty jobs. For an inexpensive drill/driver it is good. My only complaint is after assembling several plastic patio chairs requiring about 10 screws each the torque clutch is becoming loose and you have to move to the next tighter setting to drive the same screw. This may become an issue after extended use. All in all a typical B&D homeowner utility tool.
customer_reviews.author: Skip M

customer_reviews.title: Chuck seized right out of the box, two in a row
customer_reviews.text: Can't say how the drill works. I'm returning the replacement for the first order, as both came with a frozen keyless chuck. The two halves will not move independent of one another, there is no way to use the drill. Tried using vice grips to move the first one, neither of us could budge them. Probably a manufacturing defect that assembles it and fuses them together. Guess I return #2 and see if #3 is any good. Cannot recommend this, apparently B&D doesn't have quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Pilotadjuster

customer_reviews.title: Always Ready for Light-Duty Household Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old B+D 3.6 volt drill for typical, light-duty household jobs. It has enough power for this type of work, unlike the unit it replaced, but I doubt it would suffice for heavy-duty work. With the lithium battery its always ready to run and rarely needs recharging. The light is a good idea that is not well designed: it doesn't throws light where the drilling occurs, but I didn't know it had a light when I bought it so that's not a major factor for me. The torque-sensing clutch is a new capability for me, but it could be useful in some applications.
customer_reviews.author: SetterSpeaker

customer_reviews.title: Great drill for DIY jobs
customer_reviews.text: B&D have done a great job with this drill. It's by no means the most heavy-duty power drill out there, but this is a great drill for simple tasks around the house: assembling furniture, DIY projects, etc. The light is a nice touch as are the adjustable torque settings. It fits great in the hand and is easy to use and it has great battery life too. We like them so much we have two now. The battery is also compatible with other B&D tools. Highly recommend this drill and other B&D tools!
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: but as it turns out its the perfect size for my smaller lady hands
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have a few household projects I want to tackle and as my hands get older they are losing strength etc - trying to do things the old fashioned way- with a screw driver and elbow grease, or more often with a butter knife and elbow grease - just wasn't getting it anymore. I didn't expect it to be as small as it is, but as it turns out its the perfect size for my smaller lady hands. Not as big as what I would deem a normal sized drill but not tiny by any stretch and so far has the power to do the things I'm willing to tackle on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Maybee

customer_reviews.title: Just ok...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price but this is absolutely an item where spending more will yield better quality and durability. If you are buying for the occasional at home task, it might be ok. We are always doing projects at home so we needed a commercial grade product to keep up with my honey do list - lol ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Wait for a sale
customer_reviews.text: Nice little drill for super light duty. Feels and looks like a toy, but it works and is easy to handle. I paid $49.00 and two weeks later it was on sale for $29.00. I would have given 5 stars had I paid that amount, but at $49.00 I was a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill Period
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill for the price. This drill is on par with drills 2 to 3 times the price. The only bad part is if you are going to be using this drill for an entire day, you might need to pick up a replacement battery to keep working. However, I have used this drill for 4-5 hours at a time without it having any inclination of losing a charge. When I am working all day, during any downtime I will simply put the battery back on the charger and let it charge until I need it again. By doing this, I have never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: AB3

customer_reviews.title: Battery will not charge at all, right out of the box!?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill for future use and did not open it for quite awhile. The day I really needed it, I had to stop everything and charge the battery. After 4 1/2 days continually in the charger, the red light was still blinking. The box shows that a green light goes on when charged. I placed the 12 V into it place thinking it must have some charge by now, and to my surprise and frustration I now need to buy a battery and all my projects stopped dead! Very annoyed. Cannot rate the light or anything else because it won’t work? Can I return it after waiting so long and assuming this would work? Help,
customer_reviews.author: April D.

customer_reviews.title: Great woman’s drill
customer_reviews.text: I am a single woman and own my home. I need a drill occasionally for hanging window blinds, towel bars, etc and this is the perfect drill to have around. It works so nicely I’m looking around to see what else I can use it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic, Lightweight, and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: You might think this drill could not perform well when tasked with heavy duty work, but this drill will puncture through 2 4x4s and create a 6" hole with a 3/16" bit. Due to the light weight of the drill, you might want to ease off for a minute between drilling holes to avoid burning this thing out. No issues so far on my project, and with the battery and charger included, this thing is a steal. Battery lasted me through drilling 30 6" holes and screwing 30 screws and showed no signs of slowing down. I only set the battery back on the charger because I ran out steam before the battery did.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Moussa

customer_reviews.title: Great drill for light projects
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally dropped my previous black+decker in the canal while working on a boat lift.. Ordered this as a replacement. I have a few black and decker 20v lithium tools so it’s great having a bunch of batteries charged and at my disposal. This is a great little drill for LIGHT projects. Not for heavy duty applications. So if your that tough guy who needs to carry a 20lb hammer drill around the house to hang some blinds, I do not recommend this. If you’re like me and want to only pull out the heavy gear when required, this is a handy tool. The LED light is a nice add on too.
customer_reviews.author: MarkSonic

customer_reviews.title: Service support is non existant
customer_reviews.text: The Driver works fine, good power, but mine came with a defective charger. Fortunately i have a 12 volt drill that has the same charger; the bad news is there is no service support from BandD. Their web page is a joke, no way to dis cuss promlem on line. only option is to call the help line. I tried twice, both times after listen to music for 25 minutes, I was informed that they couldn't help me at this time. After using countless products over the years this is the worst customer service I've encountered. So I'm forced to return the entire procict. shame on BlackandDedker.
customer_reviews.author: C. H Mitchum

customer_reviews.title: JUST THE RIGHT SIZE
customer_reviews.text: THIS DRILL IS SMALLER THAN THE MAKITA, & CRAFTSMAN DRILLS I HAD BEFORE. THE BATTERIES WENT DEAD ON BOTH DRILLS, & IT WAS CHEAPER TO BUY THIS NEW ONE. IT USES THE SAME 20V BATTERY AS MY B&D WEED WACKER, & LEAF BLOWER I JUST PURCHASED. SO NOW I HAVE 3 BATTERIES THAT I CAN USE ON 3 TOOLS. IT IS NICE TO HAVE SPARES. I HAVEN'T USED THE DRILL YET, SO I CAN'T COMMENT ON IT'S ABILITY. I DO LIKE IT BEING LIGHTWEIGHT, & THE LED LIGHT IS A PLUS.
customer_reviews.author: GOLDENROD

customer_reviews.title: loving it
customer_reviews.text: just gotta remember that to switch between the drill and driver setting and you're goldie. we use 18v ryobies at work, so when i finally was able to buy my own place, i stuck with ryobi. my mistake was going with the 12v instead of the stations' standard 18v. but i had other black and decker tools with a 20 v battery that have performed incredible, so once the ryobi batteries died, i just recycled them to the depot and bought this, which has preformed remarkably well. 20 v is a step up from 18v.
customer_reviews.author: christopher l sandoval

customer_reviews.title: The Black and Decker LDX120C Lithium Ion Drill/Driver gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Black and Decker Lithium Ion Drill for everyday work projects with no issue. This drill has plenty of torque for everyday tasks, cuts through drywall, plaster, metal, wood, and in some cases concrete with ease. It depends on the drill bit you are using for the job. The included "light" that shows the area where you are trying to drill or use the driver is another plus, though I think that should be a standard feature on any drill/driver by now. So, what are you waiting for? Get one and get to work. Also, get the Black and Decker BDA91109 Combination Accessory Set (109 piece) to give you the bits you need.
customer_reviews.author: Ian G. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: My first drill and I love it
customer_reviews.text: This was my very first drill. When I got it, I was so excited at how easy it was to use that I went around taking all kinds of screws out of the wall. I assembled furniture with ease and changed door handles and light switch plates all over the house. I also bought a brush head set to do some deep cleaning, which was also exciting to see the dirt just lift up with ease. My father, who has worked with lots of power tool in his career also said it's a solid drill. I'd recommend this drill to first-timers and maybe even those a little more experienced.
customer_reviews.author: sunnydaytoday

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home gamer.
customer_reviews.text: If you need an around the house drill or occasional use in the shop - this is the drill you want. The lithium battery is awesome and it lasts way longer than I expected. I used to have an old nickel metal powered unit from Black and Decker and this one lasts easily 5x as long. I also like that the battery works in all the other Black and Decker outdoor tools. I got a string trimmer for free and am impressed with that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Omfgzombies!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ROI!  You will KEEP this!  :-)
customer_reviews.text: Buy with confidence! I promise you; I happily return items when I feel cheated in any way. But I will keep this! Yes, companies are not what they used to be. But remember, Black & Decker have been making drills forever! They have refined the art; and, they have a name to live up to. If they sold bad drills (A very basic tool) they would lose credibility "across the board". With that said, if you are going to be doing drilling every single day for hours, spend money to get something bulletproof. Still, I got this for about 40 bucks. Excellent ROI! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: David Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great drill / driver
customer_reviews.text: Got it to replace one I wore out. First time used it used it a whole lot. Lot's of drilling and driving screws. It's did the job perfectly and no sign's of battery getting low either.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Pepper

customer_reviews.title: It's Good for Small Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit primarily because I have a string trimmer that is Black and Decker, so I had spare batteries. Even though it is 19V, the motor overheats with lengthy use. It has only one setting, unlike most drills that have a setting for drill and a separate setting for screw driver. For the money, it is a good drill. It powers through heavy wood with sometimes dull bits. It is small and easy to store. I like that the light comes on before you start to drill; others don't. Be sure to reduce the power when using it for driving screws.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Anderson

customer_reviews.title: What a great change.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Black and Decker drill and the battery failed to charge. The new battery was $45 and this whole new drill was $49. Even at 87 years old it didn't take much logic to determine the correct course of action and I bought the new drill. Wow! What a difference. Much lighter and more ergonomic in handling. I charged the battery, although I thought it was fairly well charged, and turned on the drill. What a wonderful pleasant surprise that I hadn't noticed when I read the description. It's got a light! You can even see what you're doing in dark tight spaces. It was well worth the four bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Fichtl

customer_reviews.title: Not enough torque for a 20v drill.
customer_reviews.text: It's about as powerful as my 12v makita driver that I use 95% of the time. I bought this hoping it will fill in the 5% of the time where I needed a powerful driver. This is not it. It's more like a longer lasting light duty driver... and for that purpose it's great.... I guess this is a loaner/secondary driver now.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER LDX120C
customer_reviews.text: Got this drill on Black Friday for $24... not a bad deal for that price. I just needed something for light household use as my old blue Ryobi drill has finally wore out after 15 years of heavy abuse on construction sites. That being said, the B+D is lighter and still has plenty of torque, but does feel a bit cheap... it has a brushed motor instead of brushless, so eventually the brushes will need replaced... it puts on quite a light show of sparks. But it should do fine for around-the-house tasks. Overall happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Warren H Window

customer_reviews.title: Bought to use as a screw gun.....
customer_reviews.text: Great little drill for installing screws in different types of projects, got here in good order and took about 3 hours to charge it up. I bought it to use as a screw gun and for a lightweight drill for my wife. For that Arena this little screw gun is perfect, I built a shed with it also from amazon it had a couple hundred screws in it and it never failed or slowed down so I'm going to rate it a 5 in that aspect... After using it for a couple of hours it only took about 30 minutes to fully charge it!
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Rog

customer_reviews.title: This. Drill. Is. Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I used an older corded drill to install several mini blinds in the past, and I always needed my husbands help to drive the nails flush against the wall. This cordless drill is lightweight and drilled and drove the nails seamlessly. I installed my blinds in the daylight; so I didn’t notice the light.
customer_reviews.author: Midwestshopper

customer_reviews.title: Not a drill and small motor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a second battery for my B&D drill-driver. For a few bucks more, this comes with a driver and charger. It looks like the same unit I already have but it doesn't have a drill setting and has a smaller motor. I guess it's OK for a cordless driver but it won't work well as a drill. I sometimes have jobs where I need both drill to set pilot holes and a driver to set screws, so this will come in handy. Be aware when you order that this is a driver only.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Carter

customer_reviews.title: Quality and power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Drill Driver for a big project based on all the good reviews. first day I used it to drive a 6in wood lock flat head screw, this poor little Drill driver could not handle the power, and started overheating and smoking, I immediately stopped, and let it cool down, then used second time, couldn't drive the screw more than half way into a 6X6 and smoked pretty badly. Then I had to run to home depot and got me a 20V Dewalt drill driver, which handled the job like a champ. I had to return this one.
customer_reviews.author: namin77

customer_reviews.title: Lithium and newer is not always better.
customer_reviews.text: Recently I purchased a Black and Decker 20 volt lithium drill model LDX120C. I got it to keep up with the times and back up my eight year old Black and Decker nickel- cadmium drill. The new drill lost its charge after a short use and it did not have the power that my old drill has. The lithium battery that came with the new drill is rated 1.5AH, could they afford it, not enough power to stir grand ma's soup. I had to finish the job with my nickel cadmium drill. Make new friends but keep the old for one is silver and the other is gold
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wright

customer_reviews.title: Lost it's torque within a year
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Battery lasts forever. I've used it here and there for a three or so months now and it's still working off the first charge! (Of course I'm only using it for home projects/maintenance, nothing too heavy duty) Con: After one year of use (during which I somehow never had to charge the battery!?!) the day I finally decided to charge the battery the drill lost it's torque. Now, even with the drill set to 10, I can stop the drill from spinning with my bare hands :/
customer_reviews.author: ZR

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two plus years of light, infrequent use.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this tool since 2015 and have used it intermittently as needed. Certainly not in heavy duty situations or constant operation. It has just developed a problem where it will run for a few seconds and then stop. I believe the cause is a faulty trigger switch, since the battery is fully charged. May take it apart to see if I can fix it. Meanwhile, the warranty has expired so I have no choice but to replace it. I agree with the reviewer who said you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Enjoying the Desert 🌵

customer_reviews.title: Happily surprised by its power
customer_reviews.text: Truly surprised at how awesome this drill is. Needed something quick and fast to replace a cordless drill of another name brand I had for years. Expected this to be a one job wonder. It’s more powerful and lasts longer than my previous “brand” name cordless drill. Plus it was on sale.
customer_reviews.author: JJMI

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: As you can see this is a small drill. Not much bigger than my hand and I’m just 6’. Boy let me tell you size doesn’t matter. Got lots of power for a 20v Only used it for building cabinets and shelf units and it did the job on one battery. I’ll repost battery life if a larger project comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Ratcliff

customer_reviews.title: It's Black & Decker ...
customer_reviews.text: Due to my experience and the quality, I have owned nothing but Black & Decker power drills/screw drivers for decades. This newest addition did not disappoint, excellent quality, great design. I bought this to replace my old 12v drill which still works great, just wanted to up grade. I really like the new smaller, compact design; not only is it lighter, it allows more flexibility in regards to where you can use it. I also like the fact that, although smaller and lighter, it has a lot more power then my old 12v and the battery seems to last a lot longer, of course I'm comparing a new battery to one that is around 2 years old now.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but the "slip" setting is useless.
customer_reviews.text: It seems pretty powerful. I wanted a 20 Volt at a good price which this was. It seems to hold the charge pretty well. Many batteries will die if left in the drill even when not used. My only down comment is the twist lock. It goes from 1-10 and then a lock. This pretty much does nothing. You can easily cause it to slip by just just holding the end with your hand all the way up to 10. Only the lock position will stop the slip. Also, I am used to a 1 - 2 speed which this doesn't have. I guess if you are careful with the trigger finger you don't need it as it's variable.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Works right out of box, instructions took a minute, light doesnt staay on, but works
customer_reviews.text: It worked and was charged right out of the box, comes with charger, has a built in light but theres no way to make the light stay on or off it just comes on when pulling the trigger, battery was charged, just snapped it in and it worked, instructions took a minute to understand how to get the metal piece to screw out that the bit goes in but I figured it out, diagram should have shown how that part worked, also thought it came with more than one bit, but got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Balmone LLC

customer_reviews.title: Same old switch problem, too small, light weight battery
customer_reviews.text: The third time I used it the switch failed. Sometimes it works and sometimes it does not. I had forgotten that Black and Decker drills have had a problem for at least 10 years. I assumed they had fixed this long term defect but no. I will never purchase another B&D drill. The drill and battery are very small. It barely has enough to power to drive a 3 inch drywall screw and the battery last only a few minutes. As a home owner i don't use my tools a lot but this tool is just not up to any reasonable job.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic build quality, very light for the power and very efficient. Price is ridiculously low.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drill - this is the third drill I've bought (I unfortunately have to move a lot) and its the best. As we live in an apartment, I really need it for assembling furniture and didn't just want a screwdriver. Firstly, its very well made, its very responsive and its very light (although a solid drill). It has plenty of power but won't sheer the heads off screws if you overtighten. The battery is very durable. Even if you're a professional and need something to use full time, I would highly recommend it. The price is amazing - I've been a Black&Decker fan since childhood and this is just another one of their epic motors.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Needs a drive guide
customer_reviews.text: It is a good screw driver. Enough for occasional home use. You will need to buy a separate drive guide (the piece in my hand in the photo), because it comes with a flat head and Phillips bit, but you won’t be able to use it without a drive guide. It probably should come with it, but doesn’t. It’s cheap to purchase separately. I bought it in a little orange black and decker bit kit for about $6.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Clowser

customer_reviews.title: Great value, light weight, decent battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Having a bad experience with a very old battery-powered drill many years ago I have since went with corded drills for the torque and the ease of not having to change a battery often. I needed something lighter weight and was sick of having to always use an extension cord. So I took a gamble on this and was very happily surprised. It was able to give me the torque I was looking for, and the battery life was pretty decent. For the price I would highly recommend this. It's lightweight and does the job. It was a good enough product that I ended up also getting a detail sander from Black & Decker that also takes the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: J. hollandsworth

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive and good enough quality for light work
customer_reviews.text: I've never really used a drill before. I needed something simple to perform light DIY work in my new house. I was able to easily drill holes in wood and reinforce my door hinges with longer 3" screws as well as some other screw driving work. Battery charge was never an issue either. Inexpensive drill of good enough quality for light work. Note that no drill bits are included, so if you plan on starting some work as soon as the drill arrives, better buy some drill bits first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to handle yet solid feel and excellent torque
customer_reviews.text: Just received this drill so I can't speak to battery life. It seems to be a very well built solid drill. The charger is not more compact and much less bulky than previous cordless drills I have previously used. This seems to be perfect for around the house jobs and is exactly what I had hoped for and expected. If I had to do it again I might would probably have purchased the one with the case since the drill does not fit in my old drill's case.
customer_reviews.author: Stratman

customer_reviews.title: Handy little drill
customer_reviews.text: Needed a drill for holding at different angles while scrub brushing and this was perfect. It's lighter weight than some drills but still powerful enough that it keeps going even when pressing down while using it. Battery lasts quite awhile after fully charged. Great drill for my purposes. Better that the cheap lightweight power scrubbers on the market, this one should last a long time. And you can even use it as a drill !!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this drill for everyday uses. It has a good amount of power and still lightweight which was one of the key selling features. I own 3 now and keep them in various locations (basement, studio, workshop) because of their small size, versatility, and battery life, which is several hours for general use drilling and driving screws. My wife also prefers these because they fit in her hand a little better than our full size drill and they are not as cumbersome to control.
customer_reviews.author: Matt A.

customer_reviews.title: Very small and very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this drill when I first saw it, because it is pretty small. I did not think it would be powerful enough to do much, but I was wrong. It can easily drill wood screws into a stud. The battery is powerful and seems to last a long time. I try to charge it between uses though just to be safe. Lightweight. The little LED does not do a great job of illuminating what you're working on, but that doesn't make much difference to me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris_C

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy For Home Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill for doing things around the house. I'm not using it for work so I don't have first hand experience using it that way but for the things I've used it for at home, it's been plenty strong and the battery has not let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: FROZEN CHUCK - MY LAST BLACK & DECKER
customer_reviews.text: The one I received had a frozen chuck. I am in the process of returning it. It appeared to be absolutely new, not a recycled "return" or reject. It was simply not usable as it came out of the box. This speaks to generally poor quality control, as I have seen this same problem in other reviews. I will stick with my other battery powered drills from a different manufacturer - older, heavier, not as convenient - but reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Father's Day/Birthday gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Dad's birthday, he had a project coming up, that he would be needing this, got half through putting up part of a ceiling( after just pulling out of box, and not charging, not the products fault) and the battery died, luckily they have another black and decker product. He got the idea to switch out the battery packs while the other charged, only to find out that it fit! He was ecstatic and kept on going! He has only ever used plug ins, and would now use this cordless one ANY DAY if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Sera

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit! You can get a charging unit to replace what was sent with the drill on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good unit for a cordless drill. Do not lose the instruction booklet!! If you lose the charging until, as I thought I had until I finally found it, the Black and Decker LBXR20 16v - 20v Standard Lithium-ion Charger # 90590282 here on Amazon should work as it looks just like the charger I have. BE CAREFUL because if you push it too far in it will blink red every time. If you ease it in, the green blinking light will come on and will stay all green once the charging is done.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Landlord's best friend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill to replace a more "professional" grade hammer drill/driver that ended up being more or less useless. This driver is lightweight, easy to use, and the battery life is surprisingly great considering how little the battery packs are. I am now fully ingrained in the B&D ecosystem, having four 20V batteries, the stand alone quick charger (highly recommended), hedge trimmer, weed trimmer, and leaf blower. I keep this power drill on my back porch and it's always ready to go to work.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian L.

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong
customer_reviews.text: I have a B&D 9.6v from probably 20 yrs ago on its last legs, so I bought this one to replace it. I can say that this drill is very strong, and lasts a long time. I put a brush attachment in the chuck, and was scrubbing car floor mats with it for half an hour, and it never slowed down. When I put the battery on charge after that, it couldn't have taken 30-45 minutes to show full. Really impressed with this drill.
customer_reviews.author: gt46l

customer_reviews.title: A Bargain
customer_reviews.text: I have a few heavy duty cordless drills intended for rough everyday use by professionals but they are somewhat overkill, heavy and at times akward for small odds jobs around the house. I decided to take a chance on this B&D model regarding it as a girly-drill compared to pro-builder units. What a surprise! Works great, does everything you might need it for and holds a charge for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a christmas present for my mom. She prefers cordless drills because she uses it for making glass lawn ornaments. The package arrived with only the battery and not the drill. I contacted the seller and they sent me a whole new drill and battery all before Christmas. Props for excellent customer service and my mom loves her drill. The battery life is great and it is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time on it.
customer_reviews.text: If there is a zero star. I will give this product 0. I bought it on cyber Monday it takes one more day than to arrive. It’s not actually a big deal. But it defected. The head of it was stucked and cannot be rotated . Since I got a really good deal on cyber Monday. I decided to call back amazon and let them replace this item. The replacement arrived took another one more day. Boom... same problem. Same item. Defected. I would not recommend this item . Don’t waste your time .
customer_reviews.author: Derek Song

customer_reviews.title: Just a bad product. Owned since 2015.
customer_reviews.text: I spent way too much money on this and I'm still irratated even after this long of owning it. It gets an extra star because it still works, but that's about it. I'm guessing it's worth about 30 bucks at the top of its range. The drill just simply has no power... no torque. I end up having to hand screw almost everything because of this issue. I contemplate ever buying BLACK+DECKER again, for anything because of this drill.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a casual user
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a DIY guy. This drill will get very casual use around the house. The few times I’ve used it so far it’s been great and well worth having. The build quality seems good but I have no idea if it’s good for more frequent and industrial use. The chuck took me a while to get used to. You just gotta keep on turning it until eventually your drill bit locks pretty much. At first I thought it was just turning around in circles and was broke but it’s not.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Overall Cordless Drill
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a cordless drill years ago but it just would not hold power long enough to get a couple hour job done. The battery could not be swapped out for a fresh one. The battery on this unit last good three or four hours and a fresh battery replace exhausted battery. The charger recharges fairly quickly. The size is just right for my hand. The light is very nice and a great addition to the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. FunderburgTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Pretty powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill. This would be the 3rd one we purchased now, as we have always had good luck with them. Husband really likes this one because has a lot of power and the battery lasts a long time. Having a guy come and do some construction work soon, so ordered this one to make the job go faster. The last one we had lasted 3 years. I did purchase a different brand drill after our 2nd Black and Decker 20V drill, but husband was not happy, because not enough power, so we went back to this one. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: HookedonAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This tool is part of BD's line that uses the same battery. I have several other such tools and really like that the batteries are interchangeable. The drill provides sensitive control so that - after getting used to it - it is possible to control the speed of the drill quite well. For my relatively light uses, it has worked just as expected.
customer_reviews.author: DrDan

customer_reviews.title: You’ll like it for its light weight and size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son’s Christmas present since he said he needed a cordless drill. I did so because I have had one for a few years and it works pretty good for a light weight drill. It’s perfect for homeowners for jobs around the house. I really would not call it a driver. It has settings for different torques or full drill mode. You can drive in stud size screws or unscrew a wall switch from its electric box. It size sometimes makes it easy to get into tight spots were as a full size heavy cordless drill will not fit.
customer_reviews.author: George S

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it lasted, customer support experience is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited using this product over the last couple of months. Unfortunately, mine failed after several uses. Motor began smoking randomly, then it just quit on me. I Emailed for a warranty claim, after two weeks there was no response. Then I called the warranty number int he PDF, and it made me call another warranty number. Waited on hold for an hour, so I am giving up. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Drill for a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This drill is a good value and a workhorse for the money. It comes with a 30 watt-hour (= 1.5 amp-hour) battery, giving it plenty of capacity. I used it off-and-on all day yesterday when repairing a deck, and it had no problem driving 3-inch screws. It is very compact and is a good complement to my heavy duty (but much larger and heavier) DeWalt cordless hammer drill. I like the LED light which was not expected on such an inexpensive drill. Also, there is a new charger design which takes up very little space. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: faffie

customer_reviews.title: For the price, this is a solid drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill because my old B&D NiCad drill needed new batteries which were $30 each. This was a chance to get something lighter, with VASTLY better battery technology. Well, it's 1.5 pounds lighter, has a bright light, and easy to use features. Yes, it is only one speed, but the trigger button is so big, with a long-throw, controlling slower speeds is not too difficult. If you need 2 speeds, you'll pay more and get a heavier drill. For the average household, this drill is ideal. Plenty of power, long-lasting battery with no memory issues. In fact, this battery likes being left plugged-in. It won't use much current at all, and it will actually extend the battery life!
customer_reviews.author: Waikiki

customer_reviews.title: Love all the bells and whistles...
customer_reviews.text: This drill is something else. Don't let it fool you. 1st day, I called myself installing a wall mount for my hand vacuum and this thing got away from me and pierced the ball of my finger! Ouch! Took a week or two to heal. But can't blame my new handy dandy tool because it does what it says it will do, and how! Lights up when you press the button - which is an added plus at night. This thing has serious torque!
customer_reviews.author: B Massey

customer_reviews.title: nice little drill
customer_reviews.text: It's compact, pretty potent little guy indeed, with a small light that illumes a millisecond before the rotation begins. I've got a bunch of Lithium-battery powered tools including several drills already, but at this price I had to go for it, and I don't regret it one bit. So far, it's a decent tool, feels good in hand, has plenty of torque, and works just fine. Don't have a clue how long it will last, but I suspect it's a homeowner's level of quality, so that means a long time if you don't use it but once or twice a week like me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R DesRoches

customer_reviews.title: Good handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this drill to my mother for Christmas so the price was just right as she requested power tools for the holidays 🥴 She has used it around the house to fix everything from a creaky door to her garage door. So I suppose she’s really enjoying it and it’s working great for her! It’s a must have around the house for small repairs and projects.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Best $28 I've spent
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much out of this little drill. I thought it would come in handy around the house for hanging pictures and small chores. When Covid hit I decided it was time to tear my old shed apart and replace the damaged wood. This drill soldiered through the job without breaking a sweat. I didn't use any nails, just wood screws, this thing had the power to easily run 3" long wood screws into pressure treated boards. Stayed charged for a couple days, even then it got charged just to make sure it was good for the next day. A lot of drill for the money.
customer_reviews.author: june tammaro

customer_reviews.title: The Little Beast.
customer_reviews.text: This drill is outstanding! I spent all day assembling a lot of baby furniture and hanging shelves and picture frames on a single charge. Ran like a champ! I must have only used a small portion of the charge because it took 5 minutes of charging to get it back to full charge. I had a dewalt that constantly needed charging and finally stopped working within 1yr. The Black & Decker blows that drill out of the water! The only thing I wished it came with was a case.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great drill! It is lightweight and easy to handle. Plenty of power so far. I use hex shaft drill bits and it drills with ease. Battery life is better than expected so far. This is a good buy for woodworking projects which is my focus. The light is mounted below the shaft and therefore not entirely useful. That is my only complaint. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement
customer_reviews.text: When my oldest moved out of state a year ago he took his Black n Decker cordless drill with him. I bought this to replace his and I have been using it alot with around the home fixes. It works just great and I am most happy with it. It fits real good in my hand and I actually on two occasions was happy the light is available. My son's doesn't have a light, ha ha!
customer_reviews.author: Carreon

customer_reviews.title: Great little cordless screw gun!
customer_reviews.text: I have two. They work great, hold a charge forever and meet all my basic needs. Not really powerful enough as a commercial drill, but plenty good for around the house. Battery takes about 3 hours to fully charge. I also have the B&D cordless weed-eater which uses the same battery. It uses the juice in half an hour, but having 3 batteries, even with my big yard I can get the entire thing trimmed in one session. B&D has really stepped up their cordless product line in the last few years at half the cost of many competitors.
customer_reviews.author: lalo

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold smooth end bits tight enough
customer_reviews.text: Have always liked Black and Decker through the years. Their items have been reliable and decently priced. This drill could have earned five stars but it does have a drawback. It's keyless and is a hand tightener for drill bits, which works ok except for smooth end bits. It just can't grab on to these types of bits tight enough and they slide in place. I have no problems with these types of bits on my other drill which uses a key and I can tighten much tighter. You really need to go back to the drawing boards on this one, Black and Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Varnan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting g up there in years and needed something for small tasks around the house - manual screwdrivers aren't cutting it anymore. This little drill/driver is perfect for me. Not too big, not too heavy. The battery charges pretty quick. I have used it on wood, drywall and brick, although I would not recommend it for brick. Overall it is easy to use and doesn't take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle E. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good drill for novist wood worker or home repairs
customer_reviews.text: Great little drill. It's smaller then I expected but does the job. I put it against my old craftsman 19.2 volt the craftsman has more torque then this but I'm replacing the old craftsman with this since it's 10 years old and the battery is dying out quick. Drill has a safety feature to protect the drill from burning up the motor. If you are drilling a 1inch whole and the drill stops it cuts the power to keep the motor from burning up! Nice feature to have! Only reason i rated it 4 stars is because of the torque factor.
customer_reviews.author: austin c.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Around-the-House Jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill for projects and repairs around the home. The price cannot be beat for the quality you get here. It has a very long-lasting battery, is light-weight, has a great built-in flashlight, and it has various speeds so you can choose the the perfect speed for the job you need to do. I have used to to repair my fence and build some furniture and it has worked out great! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Technosapien

customer_reviews.title: Great drill for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill for the money. It seems powerful and is just the right size--not too heavy or bulky. Does a good job for most household tasks. It only comes with one battery but that doesn't seem an issue as battery life is long enough for all projects I have undertaken. Recharges very quickly This is a very nice drill for the homeowner. It is not too big or bulky. It has a lot of power and the battery life is very good. It only comes with the one battery but that has never been and issue. Battery life has been ample for all of my uses. Recharges very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie S

customer_reviews.title: Great little drill
customer_reviews.text: Best household drill I've ever had. Not sure I'd use it for drilling holes in concrete but that's not what this unit was made for. I spend a whole day driving screws and drilling holes and the battery life was great and, being 20V, was a nice torquey unit to boot. My wife hates that it's orange but that's not a real world issue - lol. With the sale price I picked this up at, I'd be hard pressed to find a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kresan

customer_reviews.title: Great drill for a great price 👍
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a work horse. Have owned it now almost 2 years, and although I'm not a professional trades person ( I'm a nurse 😂) this is well worth the money. I have used this to install shelving, build a closet system, build furniture and other projects around the home. Still going strong and I highly recommend. Perfect for "light" use
customer_reviews.author: J-ME In AZ

customer_reviews.title: I've never loved a drill more in my life
customer_reviews.text: I've never loved a drill more in my life. This drill is powerful, holds a charge for a REALLY long time, and is easily manipulated so that you're not drilling too fast through something or putting a screw in too fast, etc. I've done a remodel on my house by myself recently, and I honestly wish I had bought this drill sooner. It's small, not exactly lightweight (not heavy either, though), and it gets the job DONE. Serious drill. I think I'll buy people this drill as a gift just for fun, honestly; anyone would be able to tell after using it once how much of a workhorse this drill is. Do yourself a favor and get good tools.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia R.

customer_reviews.title: It got locked up on my drill bit!
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, put a large drill bit in and when finished, couldn't get it to loosen and come out..... I a bit leary about it now, I had to go to my brother in laws house and he couldn't get it out either.... So I was goingvto return it but as I was boxing it up vwith my drill bit still in it, I tapped it, turned the chuck both ways and the bit came out. So I put another smaller bit in and it works again.... Still very leary about it though!
customer_reviews.author: Zoey

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this drill
customer_reviews.text: I have to say.... I had a bad IKEA drill before this that seemed like a good deal when I got it but that drill was absolute garbage now that I have this one. Of course I had that suspicion when I bought it. So, in short, this drill helped me to remember what a true quality drill should be. Maybe its not the best drill compared to Makitas or others but from my perspective, and for the price, it is a great drill.
customer_reviews.author: BRANDON GRANTHAM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drill,  great battery, smart purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love my drill, love the battery life, love that I can finish what I started without needing a charge, aaaand u can put it on the charge WHENEVER, n not mess up the memory as it is a lithium. I will never buy a nic/cad battery drill again..so with that being written...dont touch my drill, no u cant borrow my drill, buy your own, you can totally afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Heckin Gosh

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Cordless Drill.  Love Black and Decker!  My Go-To!
customer_reviews.text: Love this drill! I have had another one exactly like it for a few years now, and it's perfect. It has tons of power, the battery holds a charge, even when it's not been plugged in for a couple/few days. I use a drill daily in my work, and I have used Black and Decker for about 20 years now. My other Black and Decker cordless drill had been so abused it was literally broken and duct taped together and it still worked. These are great cordless drills! I have tried a few other off brands, and they are all junk.
customer_reviews.author: DesperadoTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: The best value, great drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a an amazing value and a great drill for 95% of those buying cordless drill. It is perfect size and weight, not bulky and best of all this battery lasts forever. I have used mine foronths on various projects and still have not charged. Liked it so much bought a 2nd one to save time when drilling holes vs putting screws in. Just buy it, you won't have regrets
customer_reviews.author: MylesD

customer_reviews.title: Great light-duty drill
customer_reviews.text: So, compared to our Hitachi drills, not really impressive, but, considering how much less expensive it was, very impressive, lol. Basically, if you plan on building a deck or some other very work-heavy project, spend more money and get something better. But, if you just want to have something around for the occasional light/medium duty project, this will totally get the job done. I bought it for my craft room so my husband wouldn't just go on a walk-about with all the drills just when I need one, so for that I'm still glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Brook

customer_reviews.title: I can drill things for myself!
customer_reviews.text: This small but pretty mighty drill is working great for my craft projects, and for little things I need to do around my home. I'm disabled and have trouble asking for help to do minor things that I want done. I was so thrilled to be able to take my karaoke machine back off by myself and vacuum out the dust! I've also drilled holes in some wood to put twine in and make rustic shelves out of them. I may not be able to install a new electric outlet, but it's the little things that help make me feel useful.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana G.

customer_reviews.title: so good that i wanted a second one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second B & D lithium drill. The one y bought first is superb . With incredible torque and quality , so good that i wanted a second one. When i saw the second one at a much lower price , i ordered it But alas , it is a diferent model ,smaller and lighter but to my satisfaction ,wirh the same size battery , interchangeable with the bigger drill Up to now, is also a good drill , but a little les torque. But is aparently as well built as the first , so as around half price will be a bargain In next ads ,please also show the bigger original one Best regards
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and light, and great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I don't need a professional level drill. I just wanted something quality and a good value. This fits both needs perfectly. You can pay more and get better, but this 20 volt drill is very powerful and light. The lithium battery lasts a long time (significant use for 3 days now on one charge), and it also charges extremely fast (it was pretty much dead when I unboxed it, but fully charged within 90 minutes, maybe less since I wasn't paying attention due to expecting much longer). Just so you know, it doesn't come with bits or a case or anything, but it is an excellent drill for a home owner doing various projects here and there.
customer_reviews.author: NineNines

customer_reviews.title: Hand-held work horse !
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3 rd time to buy one of these great lil Drill/Driver. I use mine every day ...all day having many batteries pre-charged before starting the project. I do not run them down to dead but use for a while, throw the battery into the CHARGER and grab a charged one...and repeat. Torque is strong....great tool!! Cheers T ...ALASKA!
customer_reviews.author: Soundsailor

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Only two things I don’t like is the lack of a carrying case and the lack of a two speed control that most drills like this have. The lower speed comes in handy when trying to put a screw in without stripping the screw head due to moving at warp speed. You’re only recourse is try and control the speed with the “trigger” button. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Battery crapped out after a few months of use. Drilling trough PVC was too much for the little drill and it over heated in my hand. After that, the battery crapped out and now it shuts off randomly or doesnt start. Any resistance shuts it off at any setting. The little light they want credit for is too weak now. Disappointed I was told black and decker used to be good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
